meanings.definition: Speak in a low, unclear way.
meanings.sent2: He always mumbles when he's tired.
meanings.sent3: The shy boy mumbles his thanks.
meanings.sent4: The old radio mumbles its static-filled secrets.
meanings.sent5: The wind mumbles through the trees, a soft whisper of nature.

meanings.sent1: His speech was just a series of mumbles.
meanings.sent2: The teacher couldn't understand the student's mumbles.
meanings.sent3: The mumbles of the crowd blended into a soft hum.
meanings.sent4: The distant mumbles of the city reached her ears.
meanings.sent5: The mumbles of the stream added to the peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Utter in a low, inarticulate way.
meanings.sent1: He mumbles his complaints under his breath.
meanings.sent2: She mumbles the lyrics to her favorite song.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat mumbles as it settles into its bed.
meanings.sent4: The engine mumbles as it struggles to start.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure mumbles a warning in the dark night.
